definition: ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
devils/refers to 日本鬼子, wartime term insult for Japanese
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
demons and gods at work (idiom); unexplained event crying out for a supernatural explanation/curious coincidence
wry face/to grimace/to pull a face/comic face/face mask/devil mask
little demon (term of endearment for a child)/mischievous child/imp

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

sentences.english: Why on earth have Man Booker's publicists chosen the Groucho?
sentences.chinese: 布克獎的那些公關爲什麼會選擇格勞喬這個鬼地方？

sentences.english: Since Rick never saw a ghost, he doesn't believe that they exist.
sentences.chinese: 瑞克從沒見過鬼，所以不相信他們的存在。

sentences.english: They say she plays guitar and cries and sings.
sentences.chinese: 大家都話她識彈結他，又識鬼咁叫同唱歌仔。

sentences.english: Local officials said the escape as "the devil" to help.
sentences.chinese: 當地官員稱，越獄有“內鬼”幫助。

sentences.english: The philistine is often a snob.
I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.
sentences.chinese: 我請過你的門徒把鬼趕出去，他們卻是不能。

sentences.english: I heard this house is haunted, and people always see“ghosts”here.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說這房子鬧鬼，還有人在這兒見過“鬼”呢。

sentences.english: He picks it up, discovers it is a hanged ghost's reeking rope, and keeps it.
sentences.chinese: 秋崖拾來一看，乃一麻繩，意必縊鬼之物。

sentences.english: You are afraid of ghosts and things are not like to scare themselves out of it?
sentences.chinese: 鬼和你怕的東西不都是想出來嚇唬自己的嗎？

sentences.english: Befriender:Most ghosts turned into good guys with Pink Slime.
sentences.chinese: 大多數鬼變成好人與粉紅泥。

sentences.english: Conson your present happy ghost, meet a new girlfriend Annie.
sentences.chinese: 開心鬼的今世康森貴，結識了新女友安妮。

sentences.english: The boy contended that he saw a ghost.
sentences.chinese: 這個男孩硬說他看見了鬼。

sentences.english: My daughter is suffering terribly from demon-possession.
The demons begged Jesus to let them go into them, and he gave them permission.
sentences.chinese: 鬼央求耶穌，準他們進入豬裏去。

sentences.english: Everybody likes Casper the friendly ghost.
sentences.chinese: 大家都喜歡卡士伯這個友善的鬼。

sentences.english: Confused ghosts do not know what they are pious, they asked his sister.
sentences.chinese: 糊塗鬼不知道貌岸然它們在幹什麼，就問他姐姐。

definition: little demon (term of endearment for a child)/mischievous child/imp
Two deities, one short, one tall, chained together at the ankle, responsible for rewarding the good and punishing the bad
dead person/(coll.) to die/(of a death) to happen
